title: Priestley duality and representations of recurrent dynamics
abstract:
For an arbitrary dynamical system there is a strong relationship between
global dynamics and the order structure of an appropriately constructed
Priestley space. This connection provides an order-theoretic framework for
studying global dynamics. In the classical setting, the chain recurrent set,
introduced by C. Conley, is an example of an ordered Stone space or Priestley
space. Priestley duality can be applied in the setting of dynamics on arbitrary
topological spaces and yields a notion of Hausdorff compactification of the
(chain) recurrent set.
